result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl P Cross

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Earl P Cross appeared by video.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Earl P Cross.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense requests resolution date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Earl P Cross appeared by video.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Earl P Cross.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense requests time to review discovery and offer. Case adjourned for status, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Earl P Cross in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 15 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/23/22 @ 1:30p
